answerText: Deterministic Finite Automata [or Non-deterministic Finite Automata][10] Every context-free grammar can be transformed into this machine. Unlike a DFA, these have a stack.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | South Carolina and Carlton | 14 | Science | Computer Science | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Answer some questions about theoretical computer science. For 10 points each: [10] This construct accepts or rejects finite strings of symbols based on a transition function between states that is used sequentially as each symbol of the input is read. These recognize exactly the set of regular languages.
